intro: Gustavia nana subsp. rhodantha, commonly known as the pink hibiscus mealybug plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with glossy, dark green leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value, particularly in tropical and subtropical gardens. The subspecies rhodantha is distinguished by its more vibrant floral display compared to other subspecies of Gustavia nana.
